name: Backdrop CMS
description: More than just the Drupal fork: The Free and Open Source CMS that helps you build comprehensive websites for businesses and non-profits.
description_good_justification:
Project home page: https://backdropcms.org
Project about page: https://backdropcms.org/about
interact_justification:
Download link on home page: https://backdropcms.org
Contributing bug reposts or enhancements in issues / do reviews / create add-ons, info on contribute page: https://backdropcms.org/contribute
Contribution to core, on API site: https://api.backdropcms.org/contribute
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
contribution_requirements_justification:
Standards: https://api.backdropcms.org/documentation/coding-and-documentation-standards
PHP: https://api.backdropcms.org/php-standards
CSS: https://api.backdropcms.org/css-standards
JS https://api.backdropcms.org/js-standards
Docs: https://api.backdropcms.org/doc-standards
license_location_justification: The license file was recently moved into the "core" directory because that directory is all that's replaced with each update, and we wanted the License file to be included in each update: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/1.x/core/LICENSE.txt
floss_license_justification: License https://backdropcms.org/license The GPL-2.0-or-later license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-2.0-or-later license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification:
End-user documentation: https://backdropcms.org/user-guide
Developer documentation: http://api.backdropcms.org/
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification:
For every feature release, we also create a "preview" release. here is the most recent example: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.16.0-preview
All releases available here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: We use semantic versioning. All releases available for review here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases
version_tags_justification: All releases are git tags. Releases available for review, here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases
release_notes_justification: Release notes are posted on GitHub with every release. Releases available for review, here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases
release_notes_vulns_justification: Release notes for every security release link to our public CVEs. Releases available for review, here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases
report_tracker_justification: We use the GitHub issue queue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues
report_process_justification: We use the GitHub issue queue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues
report_responses_justification: here is the "bug report" label in our GitHub issue queue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22type+-+bug+report%22+sort%3Aupdated-desc
enhancement_responses_justification: here is the "feature request" label in our GitHub issue queue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/labels/type%20-%20feature%20request
report_archive_justification: We use the GitHub issue queue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: Here is our security page: https://backdropcms.org/security
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Reports are submitted in private, via email. Here is our security page: https://backdropcms.org/security
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: We can't show you the private security queue, but we respond to every email within 24 hours, and create an issue in the queue for the security team to review.
test_justification: Our project contains it's own test suite named "Simpletest". It operates as a module within the system.
test_invocation_justification: Our project contains it's own test suite named "Simpletest". It operates as a module within the system.
test_most_justification: The "Simpletest" module includes its own tests, and runs tests from every other part of the system.
test_policy_justification: Tests are required for all new featrues.
tests_are_added_justification: Our latest release with new features is 1.16.0. here is an example of tests that were added: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/commit/522942a221faa646bd5321c9f5e0526edd555cb1#diff-d5374d0f8c0269e7ab21ed07ef9f4fbcR246
tests_documented_added_justification:
We've added the test requirement to our documentation:
https://api.backdropcms.org/documentation/contribute-to-backdrop-core#keep-in-mind
warnings_justification: PHP does not have a compiler, but we are setting up linting with PHPCS and hope to have that built into our process by the end of the year.
warnings_strict_justification: No PRs with PHP warnings are accepted. All PRs are reviewed for coding standards violations by current core committers (and will also use PHPCS by the end of the year)
crypto_published_justification: we use phpass w salt for password hashes
crypto_call_justification: we use phpass w salt for password hashes
crypto_floss_justification: we use phpass w salt for password hashes
crypto_keylength_justification: There are no keys used inside of Backdrop.
crypto_working_justification: There are no keys used inside of Backdrop.
crypto_pfs_justification: There are no keys used inside of Backdrop.
crypto_password_storage_justification: we use phpass (iterative) w salt for password hashes. The salt is defined a installation time, but easily reset if necessary. https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/1.x/settings.php#L53
static_analysis_justification: We currently run integration testing, so any syntax errors would be caught by those more complete tests. We are, however, in the process of adding PHPCS testing to our test suite, and that will add static code analysis as well. We hope to have this functional by the end of the year.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: All vulnerabilities are corrected as soon as possible.
static_analysis_often_justification: Analysis happens with our testing on the Pull Request, before it is committed.
dynamic_analysis_justification: Dynamic Analysis happens with our testing on the Pull Request, before it is committed.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Analysis happens with our testing on the Pull Request, before it is committed.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: All vulnerabilities are corrected as soon as possible.
general_comments: Backdrop CMS is a fork of the Drupal project.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: There are no keys used inside of Backdrop. no SHA-1
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: All automated tests are run against every pull request to core. See PRs for test results: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: no keys or pws are included in our repository
english_justification:
English End-user documentation: https://backdropcms.org/user-guide
English Developer documentation: http://api.backdropcms.org/
All github issue queues are in english
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
governance_justification: We have a PMC, documented here: https://backdropcms.org/leadership
roles_responsibilities_justification: We have both a leadership page https://backdropcms.org/leadership  and a list of people who have other roles and responsibilities: https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/roles-responsibilities-and-points-contact
access_continuity_justification: We have multiple core committers and PMC members. https://backdropcms.org/leadership All passwords are kept in a password manager.
bus_factor_justification: We have multiple core committers and PMC members. https://backdropcms.org/leadership

name: Alertmanager Telegram Bot
description:
A Telegram bot that receives alerts from Prometheus' Alertmanager and sends messages to enrolled users. Resolved alerts edit past firing messages to reduce white noise on chat history.

It also leverages inline keyboards to simplify interactions with Alertmanager as viewing all alerts in the group or to create a silence, either with a single-press button with predefined durations or a custom one.
sites_https_justification: All related sites are hosted at Github, and enforce TLS. Release downloads are also provided through Github, and are TLS protected.
contribution_justification: https://github.com/wwmoraes/alertmanager-telegram-bot/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

The project also ignores environment files to prevent further changes of accidental commits.

name: Contour
description: Contour is a Kubernetes ingress controller using Envoy proxy.
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Docs at https://projectcontour.io/docs
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: The source code is hosted on GitHub, so every commit is publicly available.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_tags_justification: Git tags are used for each released version.
release_notes_justification: Release notes are published in the GitHub release (https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/releases) and upgrade instructions are published on the website (https://projectcontour.io/resources/upgrading/).
release_notes_vulns_justification: Any CVEs would be published under https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/security/advisories.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: We have not received any reports in the last 6 months.
test_justification: Go unit tests and integration tests are included in the project repository.
test_invocation_justification: Tests can be run using "go test ./..."
test_policy_justification: New functionality is expected to have automated tests and maintainers will check for them during PR review.
tests_are_added_justification: Tests are run and validated for every PR and the vast majority of new PRs add test coverage.
delivery_mitm_justification: GitHub uses TLS by default (https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/releases) as does Docker Hub (https://hub.docker.com/r/projectcontour/contour).
static_analysis_justification: golangci-lint is used which aggregates a number of common golang linters.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: gosec is run as part of golangci-lint. We also use the GitHub code scanner.
static_analysis_often_justification: Analysis runs on every pull request before it can be merged.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: Contour is not written in a memory-unsafe language.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: We configure Envoy to use TLS Ciphersuites, with a default list that excludes known-insecure algorithms. See https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/v1.20.0/pkg/config/ciphersuites.go for the details.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardening_justification: Contour includes static analysis in its CI, and keeps security in mind during our design process.
crypto_used_network_justification: Contour defaults to TLS 1.3 for Contour-Envoy communication, TLS 1.2 for external secure transfer, and allows TLS 1.1 only if the user specifically requests it.
crypto_tls12_justification: Contour supports TLS 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3, defaulting to TLS 1.2
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: All certificates are validated by default.
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: Contour does not create its own headers, but requires certificate verification for all certificate use.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers. // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: Contour is only supplied as a container image, and deployed onto Kubernetes with example YAML files, documented in our Getting Started guide: https://projectcontour.io/getting-started/
implementation_languages: Go, Shell, JavaScript, Makefile, Ruby, Open Policy Agent, Smarty, Dockerfile
dco_justification: We require DCO signoff, as documented in our [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#dco-sign-off)
governance_justification: Our governance structure is documented at https://github.com/projectcontour/community/blob/main/GOVERNANCE.md
code_of_conduct_justification: As documented in https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, we follow the CNCF Code of Conduct, https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/main/code-of-conduct.md.
roles_responsibilities_justification: We document the roles in our MAINTAINERS file: https://github.com/projectcontour/community/blob/main/MAINTAINERS.md, with the responsibilities documented in GOVERNANCE.md (https://github.com/projectcontour/community/blob/main/GOVERNANCE.md)
access_continuity_justification: All keys required are stored in Github's Secrets store in the repo. You can see from our release process (https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/RELEASES.md) that the only thing required to cut a Contour release is to be a member of the Maintainers team in the `projectcontour` Github organization.
documentation_security_justification: Contour's thread model is available at: https://projectcontour.io/resources/security-threat-model/, with the security report process available at: https://projectcontour.io/resources/security-process/ .
documentation_current_justification: Our documentation is versioned and updated with each release, please see https://projectcontour.io/docs/v1.20.0/ for a representative sample.
internationalization_justification: Contour does not generate any text intended for end-users.
sites_password_security_justification: Contour's sites do not authenticate external users.
maintenance_or_update_justification: All Contour's releases are available at https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/releases/tag/v1.20.0, or via tag on Github Container registry.
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Contour has had one vulnerability in the last 12 months, with the vulnerability report available here: https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/security/advisories/GHSA-5ph6-qq5x-7jwc
coding_standards_justification: Contour's CI requires a selection of linting tools, documented in our Github Actions workflow at https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/v1.20.0/.github/workflows/prbuild.yaml. We require golint-ci, codespell, and a generated-code check.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: This is done in Contour's CI.
build_standard_variables_justification: Contour is build using Github Actions, see https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/v1.20.0/.github/workflows/build_main.yaml for our main branch, and https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/v1.20.0/.github/workflows/build_tag.yaml for tagged releases.
build_preserve_debug_justification: Contour does not require installation - we only supply a container image, which ships with only the Contour binary in it.
build_non_recursive_justification:
Contour does not recursively build, we use `go build` to only build the main Contour binary.
See https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/v1.20.0/Makefile for `make build`.
build_repeatable_justification: Contour's builds check the repo out at a particular hash, and build that. The resultant build is always the same, the repo is the only input.
installation_standard_variables_justific: Contour installs into a Kubernetes cluster.
installation_development_quick_justifica: Our CONTRIBUTING.md file explains how to do local development of Contour. https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
external_dependencies_justification: We use go.mod for this purpose. https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/go.mod and https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/go.sum
dependency_monitoring_justification: We periodically check our external dependencies manually, and ensure we are up-to-date with each release.
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Contour builds a static binary, and we provide go.mod with all the used version.
interfaces_current_justification: We keep our Go installation up to date (no more than six months old).
automated_integration_testing_justificat: Each PR cannot be merged without a CI suite passing.
regression_tests_added50_justification: We do not accept PRs that do not add tests for their added functionality, and we add additional end-to-end tests when we find regressions.
test_policy_mandated_justification: Our CONTRIBUTING.md document explains this: https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md, and the repo settings in Github do not allow merging without CI passing.
implement_secure_design_justification: Our secure development is supported by our threat model, including the documented security checks: https://projectcontour.io/resources/security-threat-model/
input_validation_justification: Contour is only configurable via config file, Kubernetes Custom Resources, or Kubernetes objects, all of which are bounds-checked.
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: Contour's configuration file allows the choice of TLS Ciphersuites, see https://github.com/projectcontour/contour/blob/v1.20.0/pkg/config/ciphersuites.go for the options.
crypto_credential_agility_justification: All keypairs used by Contour must be placed in Kubernetes Secrets.
version_tags_signed_justification: This is not finished yet, due to complexities about signing container images.

name: octant
description: Highly extensible platform for developers to better understand the complexity of Kubernetes clusters.
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
contribution_requirements_justification:
Our hacking guide instructs folks to run formatting and CI/CD checks and our contributing guide explains our proposal process as well as our planning and organization process.

https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/HACKING.md
https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification:
https://octant.dev/docs/master/index.html#installation

and 

https://octant.dev/docs/master/index.html#getting-started
documentation_interface_justification:
https://reference.octant.dev provides frontend documentation

and

https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant@v0.13.1/pkg/plugin?tab=doc provides API documentation
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>.
report_process_justification: GitHub issues and github issue templates for bug and feature requests https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/issues
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: VMware has established an email address that should be used for reporting a vulnerability. Please send descriptions of any vulnerabilities found to security@vmware.com. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/SECURITY.md
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: VMware has established an email address that should be used for reporting a vulnerability. Please send descriptions of any vulnerabilities found to security@vmware.com. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/SECURITY.md
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: We have had 1 reported and fixed it in a few hours.
build_justification: We ship a go helper that requires simply running `go run build.go`
build_common_tools_justification: We ship a go helper that requires simply running `go run build.go`
build_floss_tools_justification: Build using `go` and `go-releaser` in our actions pipeline
warnings_justification: go lint enforced on ci and part of our build.go helper
warnings_strict_justification: We provide a flag that turns up the verbosity of warnings at runtime to ensure no errors or warnings are hidden from the user.
know_secure_design_justification: Secure software development was a required training for most of the team working on Octant.
know_common_errors_justification: Secure software development was a required training for most of the team working on Octant.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: go fmt, go lint, and go test -race seem to find the most common issues, so we don't use 3rd party tooling
dynamic_analysis_justification: we do not use dynamic analysis tools currently
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We do not use software written in a memory-unsafe language.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification:
Both sites are in and accept engilsh.

https://octant.dev and https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification:
We register our software with the Brew and Chocolatey package management systems as well as provide platform specific packages for installation. Such as RPM and DEB.

- https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/releases
- https://chocolatey.org/packages/octant
- https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/octant#default
governance_justification: Proposal section of our contributing doc outlines how we make decisions https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#proposals and the Community Membership doc defines roles https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/COMMUNITY_MEMBERSHIP.md
roles_responsibilities_justification: Our community membership and roles are outlined here: https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/COMMUNITY_MEMBERSHIP.md and the OWNERs file tracks current approvers. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/OWNERS
access_continuity_justification: All URLs and DNS names are controlled and donated by VMware. All members of https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/OWNERS can create, close issues, and update the website.
documentation_architecture_justification: Reference site describes high-level architecture of the Octant project - https://reference.octant.dev/
documentation_current_justification: https://reference.octant.dev/ is kept up-to-date with the latest changes to APIs and components. This documentation lives along the source code for the project and is automatically generated when fixes and corrections are pushed to our main branch.
documentation_achievements_justification: We publish achievements and badges directly in our README.md on https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: Octant uses the Clarity Design System (CDS) which does best effort to follow accessibility best practices https://clarity.design/get-started/support/#accessibility-support
sites_password_security_justification: None of our websites store any passwords.
maintenance_or_update_justification: We maintain a changelog at https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md in this changelog we call out any potential deprecations or incompatibles. Octant itself provides direct fixes and does minor version releases to address any issues that are encountered during the upgrade process.
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: We give credit, expect when the reporter(s) aske to be anonymous. Example https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/security/advisories/GHSA-gpjj-rqgr-4pqp
coding_standards_justification: We document for contributors the steps they must take before submitting a PR. This includes a language formatting step. This is also enforced by our GitHub Actions pipeline. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/HACKING.md#before-your-pull-request
coding_standards_enforced_justification: Our build tooling automatically formats the code to our standards. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/build.go#L123
build_standard_variables_justification: Our custom build binary respects all of the known environment variables for building `go` programs. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/build.go
build_preserve_debug_justification: Our custom build binary does a pass-through of debugging flags and environment variables. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/build.go
build_non_recursive_justification: Our custom build binary DOES NOT perform recursive builds of any subdirectory dependencies. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/build.go
build_repeatable_justification: Our custom build binary does a bit for bit production when the repository is on a given commit, for the platform. We help ensure this by committing our vendor folder to ensure reproducible builds.
installation_standard_variables_justific: Currently Octant is self-install from a zip, deb, or rpm OR using a 3rd party package manager.
installation_development_quick_justifica: We provide hacking instructions for developers which include running the tests as part of the base line sanity check of running the steps. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/blob/master/HACKING.md
dependency_monitoring_justification: Octant uses a tool called dependabot. Example https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/pull/1779
updateable_reused_components_justificati: We use go mod tool, which is the Go standard for handling dependencies and we also directly commit our vendor folder of dependencies to ensure bit-for-bit reproducible builds.
interfaces_current_justification: We ensure that we update our code and move away from deprecated dependencies using the pull requests and issues from our dependabot checks.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: Our main branch and all incoming pull requests are automatically run through our GitHub Actions pipeline. https://github.com/vmware-tanzu/octant/actions
regression_tests_added50_justification: We require bug fixes include a test to assert the previously undesired behavior has been corrected.
